urls.title: Black Feminist Sociology
urls.description: Black Feminist Sociology: Perspectives and Praxis brings together a diverse set of established and emerging scholars for a timely, accessible, and intellectually stimulating conversation regarding the foundations and state of Black feminist sociological thought. Black Feminist Sociology: Perspectives and Praxis answers three broad questions: What is Black feminist sociology?What are the guiding principles, theories, methods,...Read More ‚ÄúHome‚Äù ¬ª

I think this from @ASAnews regarding the annual meeting is bad and hostile to participants. Instead of demanding *sole ownership* of all conference content, why couldn't they could just insist on an irrevocable license to distribute it?

IMO, correct me if I'm wrong. #ASA2021 https://t.co/sSPPYGwluu

Officially done with PhD Year 1. This year, I dealt with multiple aggressions from a white female prof and was told my work wasn‚Äôt good enough. I cried a lot and I almost quit. 

But‚Ä¶I‚Äôm still here and I feel my ancestors with me today. I am so full of gratitude! #SocAF

Sharing that you don't want or need to use the title "Dr" is a privilege not everyone has. Without the title, some (particularly under-represented folk) aren't seen, taken seriously, or believed. Remember this if you find yourself questioning why others proudly display it.

Done something differently.  I felt like I was playing catch up so often, setting myself against people who seemed galaxies ahead of me. Then so much happened & it felt like even getting to the finish line took forever. Eventually I realized that my path couldn't be set against

This:

‚ÄúBlack feminism is not white feminism in blackface. Black women have particular & legitimate issues which affect our lives as Black women, and addressing those issues does not make us any less Black.‚Äù 

‚Äî Audre Lorde, ‚ÄúSexism: An American Disease in Blackface‚Äù (1979)
I'm so close to getting my first sole authored paper from my diss out the door and under review. It's a March goal of mine so I'm digging in deep the next week or so! #socaf https://t.co/Z0OvSr4zc6

urls.description: Using the frequency of keywords is a classic approach in the formal analysis of text, but has the drawback of glossing over the relationality of word ‚Ä¶

tweets.text:
1/ John Mohr used funky methods to advanced relational theories of meaning. In the #MeasureMohrCulture @Poetics_Journal special issue, @mtaylor_soc and I show how word embeddings are exactly that kind of funky method #soctwitter

 https://t.co/BH6JOLy2ox https://t.co/kLTdbAv231

Don't miss @letisha122's very cool assignment, "Social Inequality Annotated Playlist" in TRAILS. Students choose topics related to the course and then create a musical version of an annotated bibliography. Ck it out https://t.co/qpHHfcGfNE

May 3 will be a national day of refusal at universities/colleges across the country--no teaching, no classes, no webinars, no meetings. This will kick off ABOLITION MAY--a month of actions.  Tune in below! DM if you have questions
#CopsOffCampus https://t.co/ekOXstk1cT
‚ÄúYou will be rewarded for working like an animal, but you also will be treated like an animal.‚Äù This rocked me to my core, @nprAudie. https://t.co/kd7UbnUPx3

Tomorrow is the last grad seminar I'll co-teach during Spring 2021, then grading and I'm done!  But since I'll be teaching 1st summer session (starting May 24th) I'm trying to fit in a mini stay-cation before. I just need a hard reset because this year has been madness

Reminder: Look at how far you‚Äôve come, be proud, you‚Äôre doing great‚ù§Ô∏è
